perturbation.original_text:
5.  Prices and payment
5.1
The prices to be paid by the Distributor to the Supplier for the Products are to be the Price, as set out in
Schedule 4.
5.2
Any and all expenses, costs and charges incurred by the Distributor in the performance of its obligations under
this agreement will be paid by the Distributor, unless the Supplier has expressly agreed in advance in writing to
pay such expenses, costs and charges.
5.3
The Distributor must pay the full amount invoiced to it by the Supplier in USD$’s within thirty (45) days of the
date of invoice.
5.4
Neither party may withhold payment of any amount due to the other because of any set-off, counter-claim,
abatement, or other similar deduction.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.  Prices and payment
5.1
The prices to be paid by the Distributor to the Supplier for the Products are to be the Price, as set out in
Schedule 4.
5.2
Any and all expenses, costs and charges incurred by the Distributor in the performance of its obligations under
this agreement will be paid by the Distributor, unless the Supplier has expressly agreed in advance in writing to
pay such expenses, costs and charges.
5.3
The Distributor must pay the full amount invoiced to it by the Supplier in USD$’s within fifteen (15) days of the
date of invoice.
5.4
Neither party may withhold payment of any amount due to the other because of any set-off, counter-claim,
abatement, or other similar deduction.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the payment term from 'thirty (45) days' to 'fifteen (15) days' creates a direct contradiction and introduces uncertainty in enforcement. The parenthesis suggests a grace period which is undermined by the changed payment time.

perturbation.original_text:
11.  Duration and termination
11.1
This agreement begins on the Commencement Date and, subject to clause 11.2, shall continue for an initial
term of one (1) years (Initial Term) and indefinitely after that until terminated by either party giving at least
twelve (12) months' prior written notice to expire on or after the expiry date of the initial term.
11.2
Without affecting any other rights that it may be entitled to, either party may give notice in writing to the other
terminating this agreement immediately if:
(a)
the other party fails to pay any amount due under this agreement on the due date for payment and
remains in default not less than 14 days after being notified in writing to make such payment; or
perturbation.changed_text:
11.  Duration and termination
11.1
This agreement begins on the Commencement Date and, subject to clause 11.2, shall continue for an initial
term of one (1) years (Initial Term) and indefinitely after that until terminated by either party giving at least
twelve (12) months' prior written notice to expire on or after the expiry date of the initial term.
11.2
Without affecting any other rights that it may be entitled to, either party may give notice in writing to the other
terminating this agreement immediately if:
(a)
the other party fails to pay any amount due under this agreement on the due date for payment and
remains in default not less than 30 days after being notified in writing to make such payment; or
perturbation.explanation: Changing the default period from 14 days to 30 days contradicts with the earlier changed clause about payment within fifteen days. If a party does not pay within 15 days as said in clause 5.3, but termination only occurs after 30 days of notification as stated in the changed clause 11.2, then there is a contradiction about when a default on payment can lead to contract termination, making enforcement uncertain.

perturbation.original_text:
5.  Prices and payment
5.1
The prices to be paid by the Distributor to the Supplier for the Products are to be the Price, as set out in
Schedule 4.
5.2
Any and all expenses, costs and charges incurred by the Distributor in the performance of its obligations under
this agreement will be paid by the Distributor, unless the Supplier has expressly agreed in advance in writing to
pay such expenses, costs and charges.
5.3
The Distributor must pay the full amount invoiced to it by the Supplier in USD$’s within fifteen (15) days of the

5.4
Neither party may withhold payment of any amount due to the other because of any set-off, counter-claim,
abatement, or other similar deduction.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.  Prices and payment
5.1
The prices to be paid by the Distributor to the Supplier for the Products are to be the Price, as set out in
Schedule 4.
5.2
Any and all expenses, costs and charges incurred by the Distributor in the performance of its obligations under
this agreement will be paid by the Distributor, unless the Supplier has expressly agreed in advance in writing to
pay such expenses, costs and charges.
5.3
The Distributor must pay the full amount invoiced to it by the Supplier in USD$’s within fifteen (15) days of the
date of invoice. However, in extenuating circumstances, the distributor may request a 30 day payment extension.
5.4
Neither party may withhold payment of any amount due to the other because of any set-off, counter-claim,
abatement, or other similar deduction.
perturbation.explanation: The added sentence 'However, in extenuating circumstances, the distributor may request a 30 day payment extension' creates a contradiction in terms of payment schedule. While clause 5.3 mandates payment within 15 days, the added sentence introduces the possibility of a 30-day extension, leading to ambiguity in the enforceable payment deadline.
